stadium.name: The Hollow Mine
stadium.description: The playing field is the circular, wildflower-covered clearing at the base of the imposing, ivy-covered Watch Tower. The ground hums with a strange energy, and the home team makes their entrance from the newly-opened mine shaft that bores deep into the tower's foundation.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing how many dried beans they can fit in their nostril.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.

Tugging on their left earlobe three times.

stadium.name: The Guilder's Field
stadium.description: An opulent stadium sponsored by the powerful Merchant's Guild. The stands feature luxurious, velvet-lined boxes for bankers, who are often more focused on making deals than the game.

stats.pregame_ritual: Washing their hands with dirt.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Lighting a small piece of parchment on fire and inhaling the smoke.
Meticulously cleaning each stud on their boots with a special brush.
Eating a raw onion, layer by layer, without crying.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
A team-wide moment of absolute silence to 'gather their thoughts'.
Sharpening the edges of their blunted weapon (an exercise in futility).
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Lighting a small piece of parchment on fire and inhaling the smoke.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Lighting a small piece of parchment on fire and inhaling the smoke.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.

Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Meticulously cleaning each stud on their boots with a special brush.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.

preGame:
### üéôÔ∏è STEP RIGHT UP, SPORTS FANS! üéôÔ∏è

Welcome to the final regular-season showdown in the heart of Wyrmwood Hollow! I‚Äôm your host, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the wildflower-covered clearing of the Hollow Mine! Can you feel that, folks? The ground is literally humming with energy, or maybe that‚Äôs just the vibration of the mine shaft opening to spit out our home team, The Wyrmwood Stronghammers! These gritty mine-dwellers are looking to put on a show today, and while they aren't my beloved Ebon Gate Corruptors, they certainly know how to swing a maul!

I just caught a glimpse of the pre-game festivities in the dugout. Ultun Barthelemy is currently braiding a teammate's nose hair for good luck‚Äînow that‚Äôs the kind of locker-room chemistry that builds a championship legacy! Meanwhile, Autumn Jodoin just downed a raw egg, shell and all! That‚Äôs the kind of calcium-rich violence I love to see. They‚Äôre facing off against the high-and-mighty New Prosperity Profits, a team backed by the Guild of the Black Sky. I see those velvet-lined boxes filling up with bankers who wouldn‚Äôt know a real fight if it bit them on their gold-lined backsides!

Speaking of the Profits, keep an eye on Boleslaw Heathcote, who is currently inhaling the smoke from a burning piece of parchment. Perhaps she‚Äôs looking for divine guidance from that kissless money-priest Brennen Farno? Hah! I doubt the 'Benevolent' Nikos Thanae could even find this stadium without a map and a bodyguard! The Profits might have the popularity and the coin, but the Stronghammers have the Humming Earth and a mean Mine Draft on their side. The playoffs are looming, the Tangled Vines are hungry, and the Everwar is ready to claim its weekly tax of teeth and bone! Let‚Äôs get this ball in the air!
postGame:
### üí• FINAL SCORE: PROFITS 2 - STRONGHAMMERS 3 üí•

What a humdinger of a match, folks! The Wyrmwood Stronghammers have held the line in a display of sheer, unbridled grit that would make any demon's heart swell with pride! It was a seesaw of shattered limbs and spectacular plays from the very first whistle. The Profits might have the deeper pockets, but money can't buy you a win when there's a leather troll head on the line and a maul in your face!

Things started off with a real crack as Odelia Abbott absolutely leveled Pulchi Benyamin! The sound of that impact echoed off the Watch Tower, sending the Profits' star straight to the dirt! But these 'Profits' didn't stay down for long‚ÄîYoshi Cathy sought immediate vengeance, tackling Odelia right back into a state of unconsciousness. That‚Äôs the kind of back-and-forth I live for! It‚Äôs certainly more exciting than watching Sir Randy fumble with his fancy bow in the woods!

Just as the dust was settling, Abramson Doxia decided Godart Urissa had seen enough of the sky and put them down hard! The crowd was roaring, the earth was humming, and the stadium was practically vibrating with the thrill of the hunt. Amidst the carnage, Faina Hendrix showed why those merchant-backed suits are so dangerous, launching a spectacular two-point shot from the Home Field to put the Profits up early! You could almost hear Chairman Farno counting the copper in his sleep from here!

But don't you dare count out the Stronghammers! Autumn Jodoin, clearly fueled by that pre-game raw egg, missed his first attempt but didn't let that dampen his spirits. He scooped that troll head right back up and nailed a shot from the Away Field to tie it up! It was a display of persistence that would leave the Haven Lights weeping into their overpriced tea. Talk about a comeback for the ages!

By the time Halftime rolled around, the healers were sweating more than a thief in a room full of Wardens. Hamburger Marthe and Merissa Mathian were stitching together what was left of their squads. It‚Äôs the beauty of the Everwar, listeners‚Äîlose a lung, get it back, and get back in the game! The atmosphere in the second half was thick enough to choke a gargoyle, especially with that Mine Draft chilling the pampered skin of the New Prosperity visitors.

Then came the play that brought the house down! Ultun Barthelemy, with nose hair still impeccably braided, charged through the defense like a runaway cart and dunked that troll head straight into the basket for a touchdown! The Wyrmwood fans went absolutely wild, nearly drowning out the sound of Faina Hendrix trying to break Cornela Piscatelli in half‚Äîwhich he did, by the way! Another injury for the highlight reel!

Godart Urissa returned to the field with a vengeance that would make even Dima the shadow king nervous. Godart went on a total rampage, first injuring Gladdie Farika and then circling back to put Pulchi Benyamin back in the dirt for the second time tonight! It was a masterclass in persistence, folks! It‚Äôs a shame Governor-King Zenku wasn't here to see it, though he‚Äôd probably just be ashamed of the lack of proper masks on the field.

The Profits tried to orchestrate a late-game miracle, but their coordination fell apart faster than one of Chairman Toland‚Äôs stale biscuits. Passes were dropped, tackles were missed, and Milman Galvan even found time to put Rebane Kendy out of the game just for good measure. The Stronghammers‚Äô defense held firm as the clock ticked down, proving that hard work and nose-hair braiding beats a guild's gold every day of the week!

In the end, the Guilder's gold couldn't buy a victory in the Hollow Mine. The Wyrmwood Stronghammers walked away with a 3-2 win, leaving the Profits to lick their wounds and explain their losses to the Merchant's Guild. I hope Brennen Farno likes red ink, because his team is swimming in it tonight! 

What a way to end the season! What a night for violence! No heroes here, just winners and the soon-to-be-resurrected losers! We‚Äôre heading into the playoffs with blood on the grass and fire in our hearts! This is Nok the Corrupter signing off from Tuesday Night Trollball! Stay vicious, Osterra! üèüÔ∏èüëπüî•
